==Early life==
==Early life==
â
Anastas Mikoyan was born in the [[Armenia]]n village of [[Sanahin]] (now part of [[Alaverdi]]) in [[Russian Armenia]]. His father, Hovannes, was a carpenter while his mother was a rug weaver. Mikoyan was educated and graduated from the Nerseesyan Theological seminary in [[Tbilisi]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]].<ref name="SovArmenian">{{hy icon}} [[Viktor Hambardzumyan|Hambartsumyan, Viktor]] et. al., ''Anastas Hovhannesi Mikoyan'' (Ô±Õ¶Õ¡Õ½Õ¿Õ¡Õ½ ÕÕ¸Õ¾Õ°Õ¡Õ¶Õ¶Õ¥Õ½Õ« ÕÕ«Õ¯Õ¸ÕµÕ¡Õ¶), Soviet Armenian Encyclopedia, Vol. 7, Yerevan 1981 p. 542</ref> He would later remark that his continued studies in theology drew him closer to [[atheism]], ''I had a very clear feeling that I didn't believe in God and that I had in fact received a certificate in materialist uncertainty; the more I studied religious subjects, the less I believed in God''.<ref name="Timemag"/> In school, he had taken several courses on [[liberal]] and [[socialist]] principles which later interested him in the advent of leftist revolutionary movements in Russia.
+
Anastas Mikoyan was born in the [[Armenia]]n village of [[Sanahin]] (now part of [[Alaverdi]]) in [[Russian Armenia]]. His father, Hovannes, was a carpenter and his mother was a rug weaver. Mikoyan was educated and graduated from the Nerseesyan Theological seminary in [[Tbilisi]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]].<ref name="SovArmenian">{{hy icon}} [[Viktor Hambardzumyan|Hambartsumyan, Viktor]] et. al., ''Anastas Hovhannesi Mikoyan'' (Ô±Õ¶Õ¡Õ½Õ¿Õ¡Õ½ ÕÕ¸Õ¾Õ°Õ¡Õ¶Õ¶Õ¥Õ½Õ« ÕÕ«Õ¯Õ¸ÕµÕ¡Õ¶), Soviet Armenian Encyclopedia, Vol. 7, Yerevan 1981 p. 542</ref> He would later remark that his continued studies in theology drew him closer to [[atheism]], ''I had a very clear feeling that I didn't believe in God and that I had in fact received a certificate in materialist uncertainty; the more I studied religious subjects, the less I believed in God''.<ref name="Timemag"/> In school, he had taken several courses on [[liberal]] and [[socialist]] principles which later interested him in the advent of leftist revolutionary movements in Russia.
